WorkItem.Description: If you have a TS file that only contains type information (just interface definitions for example), TSC will not generate a corresponding JS file. It would be better if it created an empty file. By not generating a JS file in this case, it greatly complicates integrating TSC into build scripts.
WorkItem.Summary: JS files are not created from TS files when the TS file contains only type information

Comments.Message: Couldn't the build script just make the empty files?
Luke -- what do you think should happen here?
I agree we should be outputting a blank .js.
